The references to data.left are correct.  The problem is that the method assumed these attachments already existed.  They are only needed when the decorations are created for both the right top and bottom slots.  The fix is to create the attachment just before setting the control and alignment in those methods.

McQ - I'd like to fix this.  It's hard to call this one a stop-ship from an SDK point of view, but it prevents the user of the field assist API from using decorations on the right top and right bottom at the same time.  The fix needs more testing, but I consider it low risk to the Eclipse SDK since decorated fields are not used anywhere on the right hand side of a field (hence this bug exists!) and the code is only invoked when decorations exist on the bottom right and top right at the same time.  This could effect any Callisto plug-in trying to use decorated fields in this way.

Side note to Christof to clarify my above remarks:  I suppose replacing the references to the decData's FormData.left to FormData.right would also solve the problem. Since the intention is to horizontally center align the decoration with the one above or below it, you could argue it doesn't matter which side gets the attachment.  The only noticeable difference would be a pixel to the left or right of center when differently sized decorations couldn't be exactly centered.
Please build a patch and attach it.

Created an attachment (id=42305)
DecoratedField142744.txt

Don't be alarmed by the amount of changes.  I clarified many of the comments to distinguish between those attachments that attach decorations to their field, and those attachments that horizontally align decorations.  

After comparing both fixes, I decided to go with Christof's suggested fix since it seemed most obvious to someone encountering the code for the first time.  The left attachment looks like a cut/paste error if you think it refers to the field rather than the decorations, and since we've already created the right attachments we may as well use them for the centering.

Fixed >20060524.
Verified that:
- existing uses in SDK (find/replace dialog, ImageAndMessageArea) are still working as expected.
- use of top and bottom decorations on the right hand side working as expected
- use of differently sized decorations in all positions are centering as expected

This bug got introduced after the example was modified to reflect the current graphic design proposal, which removed all right hand decorations.  Opened bug #143535 so that the field assist example will be updated to include using differently sized decorations in all positions.
